HNN.ActorForm.Title: Hide Name Overrides
HNN.ActorForm.TokenDispositionHint: The disposition of the prototype token. Configured in the prototype token settings of the base actor.
HNN.ActorForm.DefaultBehaviourHint: The current default for this disposition type. Configured in the module settings.
HNN.ActorForm.HiddenEnabledHint: Enable hiding of this actor's name in Combat Tracker and Chat Messages (overrides default)
HNN.ActorForm.ReplacementHint: The name to use instead of the Actor's name
HNN.ActorSheetButton: Configure name hiding for this actor
HNN.Settings.HideHostileH: Hide Names of Actors with Token Disposition set to HOSTILE
HNN.Settings.HideNeutralH: Hide Names of Actors with Token Disposition set to NEUTRAL
HNN.Settings.HideFriendlyH: Hide Names of Actors with Token Disposition set to FRIENDLY
HNN.Settings.HideSecretH: Hide Names of Actors with Token Disposition set to SECRET
HNN.Settings.HidePartsH: Hides all parts of the name in chat card text e.g. Ancient Green Dragon will replace all instances and combinations of Ancient, Green, and Dragon
HNN.Settings.HostileReplacementH: The default name to use when replacing Hostile Actor names
HNN.Settings.NeutralReplacementH: The default name to use when replacing Neutral Actor names
HNN.Settings.FriendlyReplacementH: The default name to use when replacing Friendly Actor names
HNN.Settings.SecretReplacementH: The default name to use when replacing Secret Actor names
HNN.Settings.TokenNameHiddenSuffixH: The string that gets appended to the token name of hidden tokens in the GM's view
HNN.Settings.ShowOnActorDirectoryH: When enabled, the show/hide button will appear next to actors in the Actors Tab
HNN.Settings.ShowOnTokenHUDH: When enabled, the show/hide button will appear in the Token HUD (right click menu)
